message: Podcasts, from true crime to comedy and talk shows, require various agreements to move an idea along from vision to production. Lawyers play a critical role in creating these agreements that help bring people’s favorite podcasts to life!

You’re invited to join Alexia Bedat, Partner at Klaris Law PLLC, for a members-only webinar exploring the role of attorneys in the podcast space, from deal-making to production and beyond. Podcasting 101: Advising Clients in Preproduction, Production, and Distribution will be held on Friday, December 15, 2023 at 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT.
bottomline: Seats are limited, and free registration is ongoing!
message3: *Please note: This presentation is accredited for one hour of General MCLE credit in California, North Carolina, and South Carolina (all levels). It has also been approved for Minimum Continuing Legal Education credit by the State Bar of Texas Committee on MCLE in the amount of one credit hour.
If you want to earn CLE credit for your attendance at this webinar, you will need to upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to take advantage of this exclusive benefit.

message: Unfortunately, rates of substance abuse disorders and mental health challenges tend to be higher amongst the attorney population. Can you recognize the signs of a colleague in distress? Do you know where to turn for help if you find yourself experiencing these challenges?
You are invited to join seasoned attorneys Tracy Kepler and Laurie Besden on Monday, December 22 at 2:00 p.m. ET/11:00 a.m. PT for Attorney Licensure and the Impaired Professional.
message3: *Please note: This presentation is accredited for one hour of Competence Issues MCLE credit in California and one hour of Substance Abuse/Mental Health Credits in North Carolina and South Carolina (all levels). It has been approved for Minimum Continuing Legal Education credit by the State Bar of Texas Committee on MCLE in the amount of one credit hour, of which one hour will apply to legal ethics credit.
If you want to earn CLE credit for your attendance at this webinar, you will need to upgrade to Justia Connect Pro to take advantage of this exclusive benefit.

Thank you for joining us for our recent Justia Webinars presentation, Podcasting 101: Advising Clients in Preproduction, Production, and Distribution . We love connecting our members with new learning opportunities and hope you found the webinar both engaging and informative.
As we continue to plan future Justia Webinars for Justia Connect members, we want to hear from you! If you have not already done so, please share your feedback about your recent webinar experience.
Still need 2023 CLE credits? Only a few seats remain for the next Justia Webinar exploring the role of lawyers in the podcasting development, production, and distribution process.

You’re invited to join Alexia Bedat, Partner at Klaris Law PLLC, for a members-only, CLE-accredited* webinar for Podcasting 101: Advising Clients in Preproduction, Production, and Distribution tomorrow at 3:00 p.m. ET/12:00 p.m. PT.
